Detailed Description

The interface for controlling a device via QDMI.

The control interface allows submitting jobs to a device, managing the jobs, and retrieving the results.

See also
qdmi/device/control.h for the device interface.

Function Documentation

◆ QDMI_control_cancel()

int QDMI_control_cancel ( QDMI_Device dev,
QDMI_Job job )

Cancel an already submitted job.

Remove the job from the queue of waiting jobs. This changes the status of the job to QDMI_JOB_STATUS_CANCELLED.

Parameters
[in]devThe device to cancel the job on.
[in]jobThe job to cancel.
Returns
QDMI_SUCCESS if the job was successfully cancelled.
QDMI_ERROR_INVALIDARGUMENT if the job has already the status QDMI_JOB_STATUS_DONE or the job does not exist.
QDMI_ERROR_FATAL if the job could not be cancelled.

◆ QDMI_control_check()

int QDMI_control_check ( QDMI_Device dev,
QDMI_Job job,
QDMI_Job_Status * status )

Check the status of a job.

Note
This function is non-blocking and returns immediately with the job status.
It is not necessary to call this function before calling QDMI_control_get_data_dev.
Parameters
[in]devThe device to check the status on.
[in]jobThe job to check the status of.
[out]statusThe status of the job.
Returns
QDMI_SUCCESS if the job status was successfully checked.
QDMI_ERROR_INVALIDARGUMENT if the job does not exist.

◆ QDMI_control_create_job()

int QDMI_control_create_job ( QDMI_Device dev,
QDMI_Program_Format format,
int size,
const void * prog,
QDMI_Job * job )

Create a job on a device.

Create a job consisting of a circuit. Other parameters like the number of shots (QDMI_JOB_PARAMETER_SHOTS_NUM) can be set via QDMI_control_submit_job. After setting all parameters, the job must be submitted for execution through QDMI_control_submit_job.

Parameters
[in]devThe device to create the job on.
[in]formatis the format of the program, see QDMI_PROGRAM_FORMAT_T for available options. Note that the availability also depends on the device.
[in]sizeis the number of bytes of the program.
[in]progis the program to run.
[out]jobis a handle to the job created.
Returns
QDMI_SUCCESS if the job was successfully created.
QDMI_ERROR_INVALIDARGUMENT if the program prog is invalid.
QDMI_ERROR_NOTSUPPORTED if the device does not support the program format.
QDMI_ERROR_FATAL if the job creation failed.

◆ QDMI_control_free_job()

void QDMI_control_free_job ( QDMI_Device dev,
QDMI_Job job )

Free a job.

Free the resources associated with a job.

Parameters
[in]devThe device to free the job on.
[in]jobThe job to free.

◆ QDMI_control_get_data()

int QDMI_control_get_data ( QDMI_Device dev,
QDMI_Job job,
QDMI_Job_Result result,
int size,
void * data,
int * size_ret )

Retrieve the results of a job.

The results of a job can vary

Parameters
[in]devThe device to retrieve the results from.
[in]jobThe job to retrieve the results from.
[in]resultThe result to retrieve.
[in]sizeThe size of the data buffer in bytes.
[out]dataThe data of the result.
[out]size_retThe size of the returned data in bytes.
Returns
QDMI_SUCCESS if the results were successfully retrieved.
QDMI_ERROR_INVALIDARGUMENT if the job has not finished yet, was cancelled, or does not exist.
QDMI_ERROR_FATAL if an error occurred during the retrieval.

◆ QDMI_control_set_parameter()

int QDMI_control_set_parameter ( QDMI_Device dev,
QDMI_Job job,
QDMI_Job_Parameter param,
int size,
const void * value )

Set a parameter for a job.

Set a parameter for a job. The parameter can be one of the predefined parameters in QDMI_Job_Parameter. The value of the parameter is passed as a pointer to the value and the size of the value.

Parameters
[in]devThe device to set the parameter on.
[in]jobThe job to set the parameter for.
[in]paramis the parameter to set.
[in]sizeis the size of the value.
[in]valueis the value to set.
Returns
QDMI_SUCCESS if the parameter was successfully set.
QDMI_ERROR_INVALIDARGUMENT if the job does not exist, is in an invalid state or the parameter is invalid.
QDMI_ERROR_NOTSUPPORTED if the device does not support the parameter.
QDMI_ERROR_FATAL if the parameter could not be set.

◆ QDMI_control_submit_job()

int QDMI_control_submit_job ( QDMI_Device dev,
QDMI_Job job )

Submit a job to the device.

Submit a via QDMI_control_create_job previously created job to the device. The job can be configured via QDMI_control_set_parameter before submission.

Note
This function can either be blocking until the job is finished or non-blocking and return while the job is running. In the latter case, there are the functions QDMI_control_check_dev and QDMI_control_wait_dev to check the status and wait for the job to finish.
Parameters
[in]devThe device to submit the job to.
[in]jobThe job to submit.
Returns
QDMI_SUCCESS if the job was successfully submitted
QDMI_ERROR_INVALIDARGUMENT if the QASM string is invalid
QDMI_ERROR_NOTSUPPORTED if the device does not support QASM
QDMI_ERROR_FATAL if the job submission failed

◆ QDMI_control_wait()

int QDMI_control_wait ( QDMI_Device dev,
QDMI_Job job )

Wait for a job to finish.

This function blocks until the job has either finished or has been cancelled.

Parameters
[in]devThe device to wait on.
[in]jobThe job to wait for.
Returns
QDMI_SUCCESS if the job is finished or cancelled.
QDMI_ERROR_INVALIDARGUMENT if the job does not exist.
QDMI_ERROR_FATAL if the job could not be waited for and this function returns before the job has finished or has been cancelled.
